div.p: A computer hardware laboratory is a facility that is equipped with various types of computer hardware and related equipment, such as servers, desktops, laptops, printers, and other peripherals. The purpose of a computer hardware laboratory is to provide a space for students, researchers, and professionals to learn about, experiment with, and troubleshoot different types of computer hardware.

In a computer hardware laboratory, students and professionals can learn about different hardware components and how they work together to form a complete computer system. They can also learn about different hardware configurations and how to troubleshoot hardware problems. Many computer hardware laboratories also include networking equipment, such as switches and routers, allowing students to learn about networking and the internet.

Overall, a computer hardware laboratory is an important resource for learning about and working with computer hardware. It is a valuable asset for anyone interested in a career in computer science, engineering, or related fields.
